0.65.text:
Hi guys, welcome to foodie gardening.
We have finally got a sunny day!

4.19.text:
I haven't got my thermals on, I can just enjoy
the weather. I'm in the greenhouse I'm planting

9.51.text:
some seeds.
the tomatoes are doing quite well actually

12.89.text:
but I need to get something else in or we're
just going to spend the whole year living

16.33.text:
off tomatoes.
Yesterday I planted chickpeas

19.37.text:
sweetcorn, this is the Sundance and this did
really well last year so I've just finished

23.98.text:
the packet of those.
And giant sunflowers and these are the ones

27.27.text:
that Nat sent me from Tulips and Teracotta,
Terracotta and Tulips. You know the one.

32.33.text:
And these are my tomatoes
these big ones need a stake in them.

35.98.text:
And these seedlings, I was a little bit worried
about putting them down onto the floor

40.26.text:
because of it being draughty down there
now we have this incredible weather I'm not

44.14.text:
too worried about it.
They're drying out really quickly though so

46.71.text:
I have been down watering them lots.
Two people that I've seen this week have said

50.12.text:
to me that they thought I'd given the plot
up.

52.47.text:
It is getting a little bit out of control
at the edges

55.54.text:
so I bought myself an edging tool from Wilkinson's
which is this niffty little piece of kit and

61.01.text:
I'm just going along and sharpening up the
edges a bit

63.61.text:
to make the plot look a bit more lived in.
I think the edges are something that the committee

67.67.text:
looks at because it gets in their way if it's
messy when they're tidying the grass

70.69.text:
so I'm going to do the edges before I tackle
the middle part.

74.87.text:
Although it looks bad
it, I don't think it is as bad as it looks

79.43.text:
I'm hoping anyway [laughs]
A few more days like this and it'll be fine

84.14.text:
I absolutely adore being at the plot when
it's lovely weather like this

87.14.text:
it's just the miserable weather that's been
keeping me away really.

90.49.text:
because the tomatoes are doing so well I'm
making some comfrey tea for them. it's going

94.98.text:
to be comfrey and nettles.
I've put the comfrey in here

97.73.text:
I've just chopped it off, I've used the whole
stalks including the flower

102.15.text:
and that's because the tomatoes are in containers
so it doesn't matter if there are some seeds

109.27.text:
in there
I'm not going to be spreading them around

111.00.text:
the plot.
And fortunately I've got loads of nettles

112.00.text:
too
so I'm just pulling these off and pooping

114.05.text:
them in
you don't really want the root.

117.02.text:
And then I'll fill this bucket with water
and you leave it for about three weeks to

120.31.text:
breakdown.
And then you can use it as a feed for your

123.71.text:
tomatoes and I usually dilute it about one
part of this kind of comfrey nettle soup

129.94.text:
to ten parts water.
I've also bought down a selection of seeds

133.59.text:
that I want to get planted this month.
So I thought if I leave them in the greenhouse

137.50.text:
I should get round to it.
I'm going to do a few of them now.

140.03.text:
I did manage to rig something up for my broad
beans

142.81.text:
and I think they're recovering, it's a bit
slow but I think they're doing ok now

146.67.text:
and I'm pretty sure the slugs can't get in
because there's now egg shells right at the

151.22.text:
bottom
and then the plastic container

153.72.text:
and hopefully by the time the time the broad
beans grow up above this container they will

157.59.text:
be strong enough
to manage if a slug has a little bit of a

162.04.text:
nibble on them.
I can't believe how warm it actually is today.

164.78.text:
I'm going to head off home now because I haven't
got any cream on and I do burn really easily.

168.52.text:
I think I'm just read because I've just been
planting those seedlings in the, in the greenhouse

172.55.text:
but I'm hoping the weather stays this way
because I've had a really nice time today.

176.63.text:
Thanks for watching guys and I'll see you
next week.
